00018         #define VERSION(ver,rel,seq) (((ver)<<16) | ((rel)<<8) | (seq))
00019 #endif  
00020 
00021 // Rev 1.5
00022 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < VERSION(2,5,0)
00023 
00024         /*
00025                 ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00026                 The following implements an interruptible wait_event
00027                 with a timeout.  This is used instead of the function
00028                 interruptible_sleep_on_timeout() since this is susceptible
00029                 to race conditions.
00030                 ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00031         */
00032         #define __wait_event_interruptible_timeout(wq, condition, ret)          \
00033         do {                                                                    \
00034                 wait_queue_t __wait;                                            \
00035                 init_waitqueue_entry(&__wait, current);                         \
00036                                                                                 \
00037                 add_wait_queue(&wq, &__wait);                                   \
00038                 for (;;) {                                                      \
00039                         set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);                  \
00040                         if (condition)                                          \
00041                                 break;                                          \
00042                         if (!signal_pending(current)) {                         \
00043                                 ret = schedule_timeout(ret);                    \
00044                                 if (!ret)                                       \
00045                                         break;                                  \
00046                                 continue;                                       \
00047                         }                                                       \
00048                         ret = -ERESTARTSYS;                                     \
00049                         break;                                                  \
00050                 }                                                               \
00051                 current->state = TASK_RUNNING;                                  \
00052                 remove_wait_queue(&wq, &__wait);                                \
00053         } while (0)
00054 
00055         #define wait_event_interruptible_timeout(wq, condition, timeout)                        \
00056         ({                                                                                      \
00057                 long __ret = timeout;                                                           \
00058                 if (!(condition))                                                               \
00059                         __wait_event_interruptible_timeout(wq, condition, __ret);        \
00060                 __ret;                                                                          \
00061         })
00062         #define MIN(a, b)       ( (a) < (b) ? (a) : (b) )
00063 #endif
00064

00268 /*
00269         Struct for communication argument in ioctl calls
00270 */
00271 typedef struct a2818_comm {
00272         const char *out_buf;
00273         int         out_count;
00274         char       *in_buf;
00275         int         in_count;
00276         int        *status;
00277 } a2818_comm_t;
